intro: Randia myrmecophylla var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various insect species.
